page.title: 19Glebe Farm, Hanworth cont.
page.content: Livestock is varied and high quality. A herd of 215 Cotswold breeding sows are reared indoors on straw in small groups. They are served by 10 high pointed boars. Piglets are weaned and fattened in darkness, till at 14 weeks they are slaughtered weighing 67 kilos. 400 ewes are served by Suffolk rams for fat lamb rearing. 60% are sold in August others are fattened over winter and lamb in March. Fat lambs are sold at Norwich Market or to local butchers. Fleeces are sold to the Wool Growers Association. 200 friesian bullocks are fattened yearly. Bought in at 10 days old in lots of 50 during the winter months, they are intensively fed, under cover, till at 10 months they are sold for prime beef, weighing 450 kilos. A small herd of Charolais produce crossing bulls and are shown at local shows.
